title: Matt Beckstrom
text:
Matt Beckstrom
Matthew Beckstrom is a librarian, author, professor, manager, privacy and security specialist, educator, and researcher with interests in libraries, education, privacy, security, intellectual freedom, information science, cyber- security, technology, and management.

title: Writing
text:
Lund, B.D., & Beckstrom, M.A. (2022). A guide to Using the Anonymous Web in Libraries and Information Organizations: Enhancing Patron Privacy and Information Access (Co-Author) , London, UK: Routledge.
Valenti, S.J., Lund, B.D., & Beckstom, M.A. (2022). Library patrons privacy: Questions and answers. Santa Barbara, CA: ABC-Clio/Libraries Unlimited.
Brady Lund & Matt Beckstrom (2021). The Integration of Tor into Library Services: An Appeal to the Core Mission and Values of Libraries, Public Library Quarterly, 40:1, 60-76, DOI: 10.1080/01616846.2019.1696078
Beckstrom, M (2019). Casting Light on the Dark Web: A Guide for Safe Exploration (Co-Author) Rowan & Littlefield.
William Marden, Jason Griffey, Erin Berman, Sarah Houghton, Jessamyn West, Eric Hellman, T.J. Lamanna, &
Matt Beckstrom (2019). Choose Privacy Week 2018: Big Data is Watching You. Journal of Intellectual Freedom & Privacy, 4:1, DOI: https://doi.org/10.5860/jifp.v4i1.6885.
Beckstrom, M (2017). Protecting Patron Privacy: A LITA Guide (contributor) Rowan & Littlefield.
Beckstrom, M (2016). LITA Privacy Checklists, Library and Information Technology Association.
Beckstrom, M. (2015). Protecting Patron Privacy: Safe Practices for Public Computers. Libraries Unlimited.
